Line 14: Line 14:
'''Wubi''' is an official [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]-based [[free software]] installer for [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]], licensed under the [[GNU General Public License|GPL]].<ref name="WubiFAQ">{{cite web | url=http://wubi-installer.org/faq.php | title=Wubi - FAQ | publisher=Wubi | accessdate=2007-06-23}}</ref> Lubi functions similarly to Wubi, however, Lubi uses GNU/Linux as the host system instead of Windows.<ref>http://lubi.sourceforge.net/lubi.html</ref>
'''Wubi''' is an official [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]-based [[free software]] installer for [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]], licensed under the [[GNU General Public License|GPL]].<ref name="WubiFAQ">{{cite web | url=http://wubi-installer.org/faq.php | title=Wubi - FAQ | publisher=Wubi | accessdate=2007-06-23}}</ref> Lubi functions similarly to Wubi, however, Lubi uses GNU/Linux as the host system instead of Windows.<ref>http://lubi.sourceforge.net/lubi.html</ref>
â
Wubi was born as an independent project, as such 7.04 and 7.10 are unoffical releases. But since 8.04 the code has been merged within Ubuntu and since 8.04-alpha5, Wubi can also be found in the Ubuntu Live CD. <ref>http://wubi.sourceforge.net/faq.php</ref>
+
Wubi was born as an independent project, as such 7.04 and 7.10 are unoffical releases. But since 8.04 the code has been merged within Ubuntu and since 8.04 alpha 5, Wubi can also be found in the Ubuntu Live CD <ref>http://wubi.sourceforge.net/faq.php</ref> and has been included on the new Ubuntu 7.10 Gutsy Gibbon distribution.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=425557 | title=Discussions for Wubi inclusion in Gutsy | publisher=Ubuntu Forums | author=Henrik | date=[[2007-04-27]] | accessdate=2007-06-23}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://wiki.ubuntu.com/InstallerForWindows | title="Installer For Windows - Ubuntu Wiki | publisher=Ubuntu | accessdate=2007-06-23}}</ref>
The goal of the project is to assist a Windows user unacquainted with [[Linux]] in trying Ubuntu without risking any loss of information due to disk [[Disk formatting|formatting]] or [[Disk partitioning|partitioning]]. Wubi can also [[Uninstaller|uninstall]] Ubuntu from within Windows.
The goal of the project is to assist a Windows user unacquainted with [[Linux]] in trying Ubuntu without risking any loss of information due to disk [[Disk formatting|formatting]] or [[Disk partitioning|partitioning]]. Wubi can also [[Uninstaller|uninstall]] Ubuntu from within Windows.
